newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Santos stevedores to begin strike April 2.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Santos stevedores to begin strike April 2.

text.p: Stevedores at Brazil's key port of Santos are set to begin a two-day strike at 0700 local/1000 GMT April 2 over a labor dispute, said the first treasurer of the Stevedores Union.
"We are having meetings now but the strike will go ahead," said Antonio Pinheiro.
"The idea is to strike on a regional level, that is in Santos, on April 2 and April 3. Then if there is no advance in negotiations, the strike will spread to a national level on April 4," he added.
Although other unions are not expected to join the stevedores, the port is expected to be brought to a halt by the strike action, said an official at the Port Operators' Union.
"At the moment, it is just the stevedores. But that is sufficient to bring the whole port to a stop without a doubt," the official said.

The stevedores are striking in protest at a new ruling which takes effect tomorrow allowing company workers from steel mill Companhia Siderurgica Paulista (Cosipa) to operate Cosipa's private terminal at the port, Pinheiro said.
The terminal was privatised as part of an ongoing national program which has been meeting resistance from unions and has already resulted in several stoppages.

An official at the National Portworkers Federation said he had not heard of any specific plans for a national strike but did not rule the possibility of a nationwide stoppage in the near future because of the privatisation program.

"We are expecting to have a very big strike throughout all Brazil...I do not know at the moment of any definite strike but things are certainly heading that way," said Jose Horatio Freitas, administrative and financial secretary.
Santos is Brazil's key port and stoppages in the past have hit shipments of sugar, coffee and grains such as soybeans.
